intro: Chlorophytum longipaniculatum, commonly known as the Tiger's Tail or Shrub Ivy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its long, trailing stems and small, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale green flowers on long, branched inflorescences, which give it its common name. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for hanging baskets and rock gardens.
